entry.title: Federal Police Uncover Major Crypto Scam: 2,000 Aussie Wallets Hacked
entry.summary:
Over 2,000 Australian-owned crypto wallets discovered by the Australian Federal Police (AFP) have been hacked by foreign fraudsters, the Financial Review reported.
Part of a larger effort called Operation Spincaster, which seeks to fight cybercrime worldwide, this concerning find marks the latest accomplishment in the war against crypto crime.
Both the AFP and the Joint Policing Cybercrime Coordination Centre (JPC3), which collaborates with law enforcement agencies from other governments to curb digital fraud and scams, have been the driving forces behind this operation respectively.
Compromised Crypto Wallets Tied To Several Exchanges
Based on the report, the compromised digital wallets have ties to several crypto exchanges, though it did not disclose in detail the names of the ‚Ä¶

entry.title: Here‚Äôs Why Bitcoin And Ethereum Price Crashed
entry.summary:
The cryptocurrency industry recently experienced a substantial reduction in its overall market capitalization as prices plummeted sharply over the weekend. This downturn was particularly notable as Bitcoin, the leading cryptocurrency by market value, fell below the $60,000 mark on Saturday, August 3. Ethereum, the second-largest cryptocurrency, also faced significant losses, dipping below $3,000 and reaching a low of $2,860. This caused other cryptocurrencies to follow suit, with most bleeding red immediately.¬†
Such volatility is not uncommon within the crypto space, where prices often fluctuate dramatically in response to various factors. These price swings are typically driven by market reactions to recent news or events. In this instance, the latest price declines can be attributed ‚Ä¶

entry.title: US Senate Moves Bitcoin Reserve Bill To Banking Committee ‚Äì Details
entry.summary:
At the recent Bitcoin conference in July, popular crypto-friendly senator Cynthia Lummis announced plans to introduce a bill that will allow the US government to adopt Bitcoin as a strategic reserve asset. Five days later since Lummis‚Äô declaration, there have been notable encouraging developments with what could be the most significant legislation in terms of crypto use and adoption in the US.
Lummis‚Äô Bitcoin Reserve Bill Explained
According to data from US Congress, Lummis, who is representing Wyoming, introduced a legislative bill on July 31 that will direct the US government to establish a ‚ÄúStrategic Bitcoin Reserve‚Äù program.¬† Speaking at the Bitcoin Conference in Nashville, the Democrat legislator previously explained that this new bill will order the US Treasury to acquire 1 mi‚Ä¶

entry.title: Grayscale ETH ETF Outflows Hit $2 Billion As Ethereum Price Struggles Below $3,000
entry.summary:
The Ethereum price performance has been a major source of concern for investors over the past few weeks, persisting in a downward trend. What makes the token‚Äôs struggles even more worrying is that it has not shown any signs of relief despite the recent launch of spot ETH ETFs (exchange-traded funds) in the United States.
However, it appears that the underwhelming performance of the ETH ETFs ‚Äî so far ‚Äî might even be contributing to the Ethereum price troubles in recent weeks. Specifically, Grayscale has been seeing a significant flow of capital out of its Ether fund, the Grayscale Ethereum Trust (ETHE).
Grayscale Ethereum Trust Hits $2.1 Billion In Outflows
Following the first full week of trading, the US spot Ethereum ETF market saw a significant outflow of funds from the crypto prod‚Ä¶

entry.title: What's the Meta? Do Crypto Degens Care About Being Scammed?
entry.summary: What's the Meta? With the rise of Pumpdotfun and rug pulls becoming a daily occurrence, why do crypto degens keep investing? Do these investors enjoy being scammed? It appears that people very often invest in meme coins that are very obviously going to rug pull. Once it happens, they just laugh it off on Twitter, is being scammed fun?!

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 162 - SOLANA LEADS THE CHARGE!
entry.summary: BTC ETF Inflows: +$85m. SOL leads majors ahead of ETH ETF. Rumours Trump may want BTC in strategic reserve. Trump BTC round-table tickets going for $845k. Polymarket hits volume record of $20m. ETH ETFs will get steady capital: Binance CEO. Winklevii donate $1m to try and unseat Warren. Tornado sees $1.9bn volume resurgence. New overlay attacks growing in crypto. Messari co-founder faces backlash on views. Raydium integrates with Moonpay. Tencent leads investment round in Chainbase. ZA Bank partners with stablecoin issuers.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 161 - THE BIG WIF COMEBACK?
entry.summary: BTC ETF Inflows: +$53m. Crypto remains stable despite macro sell-off. ETH ETF providers undercut each other on fees. Grayscale keeps 2.5% high fee, launches mini-fund. Grayscale launches ‚ÄòDecentralised AI Fund‚Äô. Dimon may be ‚Äòchanging tune‚Äô on Bitcoin. Many alts now bounced 50-90% from lows. Vote implies 55% of Mt. Gox depositors won‚Äôt sell. BlockFi to make creditor distributions this month. WazirX exchanges sees $230m suspected breach. Vitalik warns against voting ‚Äòpro-crypto‚Äô. Vitalik & Autism Capital trade barbs. Bitcoin Magazine to hold pro-Trump fundraiser. State Street explore blockchain payments. UPbit sees 44% monthly drop in volume.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 160 - CHATTING TO ROBINHOOD!
entry.summary: BTC ETF Inflows: +$423m. Crypto pushes higher, biggest ETF inflow in 6 weeks. Mt. Gox FUD ‚Äòoverestimated‚Äô as whales accumulate. Kraken to begin Mt. Gox repayments in 7-14d. ETH spot ETFs will push ETH to $5k: Bitwise. SOL ETF will be next: Bloomberg. XRP up 35% this week ahead of potential settlement. Aethir reports $36m H1 customer revenue. Craig Wright now under threat of perjury & forgery. FTX & CFTC in $12.7bn settlement. WLD up 40% after delaying unlock schedule. Helio announces instant crypto fiat commerce. Phantom pauses cross-chain swaps amid exploit.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 159 - MEMECOINS GO MAD!
entry.summary: BTC ETF Inflows: +$301m. BTC dips from $65k as $6bn moves from Mt. Gox. Coinbase & MicroStrategy surge with BTC. Genesis sells another $38m BTC. ETH ETF timeline delayed until July 23rd. Trump chooses crypto friendly Vance as VP. Old clip shows Vance bashing Gensler on crypto. Bitcoin is good during debasement: Larry Fink. Michael Dell calls Fink video ‚Äòfascinating‚Äô. Fear & Greed index shifts to Greed. Tether mints $1bn USDT on Tron. Stripe expands crypto integration to the EU.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 158 - A WILD WEEKEND FOR BITCOIN
entry.summary: Trump response optimism takes BTC to $63K. Bitcoin whales accumulate most since April 2023. Trump still set to talk at Bitcoin Nashville. ETH ETF approval this week: Geraci. XRP vs SEC press conference rumoured on 18th. Crypto funds saw $1.44B inflows last week. Rumours China is to ‚Äòunban BTC‚Äô in Q4. S. Korea may delay crypto taxes until 2028. Russia to allow crypto trading on stock exchange. All altcoin categories outperform BTC over 7d. BitConnect infamous promoter convicted. Scroll becomes 8th L2 with TVL over $1bn. ETHFI Season 2 claims available this week. Base hits record 1m UserOps in a week.

entry.title: Zoltan Istvan on AI and Human Immortality
entry.summary: Transhumanist Party founder Zoltan Istvan chats with Decrypt's Emerging Technology report Jason Nelson about his journey with transhumanism, running for office, and why he fears AI is outpacing life science and poses a threat to the quest for immortality.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 157 - ROLLBIT FRIDAY!
entry.summary: The German state sells $2bn+ BTC and has under $300m left. BTC ETF sees $800M of inflows, Mr 100 keeps buying. SOL ETF deadline set for 2025, election could be key. SOL stablecoin TVL soars on Tether & PYUSD growth. Firedancer sees the first accepted block on SOL testnet. ETH ETFs finally expected next week. Monthly active crypto addresses top 100m. Trump to speak at Bitcoin Nashville conference. Golman Sachs to launch 3 tokenization projects. Short squeeze in altcoins sees TIA rise 80% from lows. MOG leads top memes coins, BONK flips WIF. Farming interest shifts to Berachain & Monad.
